result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Alen Wschola was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Alen Wschola is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Alen Wschola was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Counts 2 and 3 dismissed.
Consecutive to the period of confinement and Extended Supervision.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to:

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF215.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF215.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Random and regular testing.
-Maintain current mental health treatments.
-MRT theraphy or cognitive intervention.
-Maintain employment.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Webb. ADA: Michael E. Nieskes, DF ATTY: Daniel J. Chapman, DF: Michael Alen Wschola appeared from jail.  Court called at 10:44 a.m   Includes 11CF303, 12CM06, & Plea in 14CF215. DE filed a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights with the court for 14CF215.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 14CF215.  DE sworn.  Crt informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF215. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 and Ct 3 in 14CF215.  Court takes Judicial Notice of 11CF303.  Court waives PSI.      
Sentencing arguements and recommendations on case 14CF215, 11CF303 & 12CM06.  Court Orders

14CF215 - 
CT 1  - S/W, 2 years probation with conditions, consecutive.  Conditions of probation are:

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.  
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Random and regular testing.
-Maintain current mental health treatments
-AODA follow through
-MRT therapy or cognitive intervention
-Maintain employment

11CF303 -
CT 1 - 8 years, 0 months, I/C  3 years 0 Months, E/S 5 years, 0 months.  Concurrent.  Conditions of E/S are:

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.  
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Random and regular testing.
-Maintain current mental health treatments
-AODA follow through
-MRT therapy or cognitive intervention
-Maintain employment
-Court costs including DNA $518 and probation costs payable through probation.  
  
CT 2 - 6mths SCC jail. Concurrent to prison.  
CT 3 - 6 mths SCC jail.  Concurrent to prison.  
CT 4 - 6 mths SCC jail. Concurrent to prison.  
- Court costs still owed on 11CF303 misdemeaners $857.62.

12CM06
CT 1 - 6mths SCC jail.  Concurrent to prison.  
CT 2 - 90 days at SCC jail. Concurrent to prison.  
- Court costs still owed on 12CM06 misdemeaners $510.30.

Court notes 242 days credit.   DE is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and substance Abuse Program.  Court revokes all bonds. DE remanded to DOC.  20 days to appeal.
